page.title: 02Farming
page.content: Mixed farming is practised on 3OO acres of land in Trelleck Grange. l7O acres is arable land, which is home to ll5 dairy cows and l8 beef cows. Potatoes and oats are grown, as well as Winter wheat and barley. Everybody gets up at 6 o'clock to milk the cows. From then onwards, cleaning the milking parlour, feeding and checking the health of all stock takes them through to lunch-time. Occasionally there is a visit from the vet or artificial insemination man. At certain times of the year the crops are sprayed with fertiliser or insecticide. Other tasks include repairing fencing, outbuildings and barns. At 4 o'clock it is time for milking again, until 6 o'clock when they finish their farming.
